Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: Simple and utilitarian in purpose, the area behind the theater stage is predominantly constructed of pale pine with cedar wood accents that perfume the air in this cramped space. A series of cedar armoires with mirrored fronts line the southern wall, the fronts reflecting the light from small chandeliers hanging from overhead. Despite the simplicity of the design, the luster of the polish and the quality of the wood betrays understated elegance and wealth used to create the space.

Simple and utilitarian in purpose, the area behind the theater stage is predominantly constructed of pale pine with cedar wood accents that perfume the air in this cramped space. A series of cedar armoires with mirrored fronts line the southern wall, the fronts reflecting the light from small chandeliers hanging from overhead. Despite the simplicity of the design, the luster of the polish and the quality of the wood betrays understated elegance and wealth used to create the space.

Simple and utilitarian in purpose, the area behind the theater stage is predominantly constructed of pale pine with cedar wood accents that perfume the air in this cramped space. A series of cedar armoires with mirrored fronts line the southern wall, the fronts reflecting the light from small chandeliers hanging from overhead. Despite the simplicity of the design, the luster of the polish and the quality of the wood betrays understated elegance and wealth used to create the space.
an arched double door leading northeast

Each side of the arched double door leading to the northeast is divided into six raised panels of equal height and width, topped with a stationary seventh semicircular panel at the apex which spans the full width of the doorway. Painted a flawless porcelain white, each panel is decorated with an intricate raised floral engraving accented with gold leaf. $(parent-desc)
